bioghist.p: Bernstein received an AB degree from Cornell University in 1936. Immediately after graduation, he joined the staff of the Steel Workers Organizing Committee. After serving as a sergeant in the U.S. Air Corps during World War II, Bernstein was rehired by the successor of the Committee, the United Steelworkers of America (CIO) as a research assistant and national representative. Bernstein became the union's specialist in international labor and was eventually made its international affairs director.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of an unpublished typescript by Meyer Bernstein on the United Steelworkers of America's strike against the Georgetwon Steel Corporation.
